channel.title: Google: more than you want?
channel.description:
I don't know about you guys, but when I load certain pages, Google knows about it (their add on: AdSense). Bottom left of your browser, says 'Done' right? Mine does. When you load a page, it tells you what's going on. Well, everytime I load a page, although very fast, I notice Google. Don't believe me? While writing this, I opened a new browser and went straight to this site. My home page is Verizon, I didn't even cross Google (haven't gone on Google in days), and it's there. It was lagging, so I managed a screeny:
[IMG]http://i43.tinypic.com/1zxco1.jpg[/img]
Now, if you take a closer look, you'll notice that we [b]wait[/b] for Google in order to access this page (which is why mine lagged):
[IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/fxz2oj.jpg[/img]
This is every site you encounter. Not that exact address, but Google. Why exactly does Google keep track of where we go?

[/quote]
I heard running in squares was impossible[/quote]
i heard running in doubledodecahedrans was impossible

item.title: Google: more than you want?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It’s because of my google adsense ads which others have already said. Feel free to block them if you wish, I simply have one at the top and one at the bottom to pay the hosting costs for the site.

Read full topic

item.title: Google: more than you want?
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

When I run Firefox, my pages don’t fully load and have the weird lines bugging out (like when you point a camera at a computer/TV)

casey.:

There’s an ap on firefox that blocks anything google related

Death to Google >:[

Read full topic

item.title: Google: more than you want?
item.dc:creator: @P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut `Lewk_
item.description:
@P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut wrote:

Most likely Mitb is signed up for the Adsense program… As am I, When people click the adverts on your page you make some money. I’m not really sure how it works… All I really did was put a bunch of ads on my website. Most people that run a successful site have this. As well as free web hosting services.

P.s
Internet explorer?
FAIL. Get some chrome up in dat mthrfker

Read full topic
